title: When Geometric Deep Learning Meets Pretrained Protein Language Models

title_detail.value: When Geometric Deep Learning Meets Pretrained Protein Language Models

summary:
Geometric deep learning has recently achieved great success in non-Euclidean
domains, and learning on 3D structures of large biomolecules is emerging as a
distinct research area. However, its efficacy is largely constrained due to the
limited quantity of structural data. Meanwhile, protein language models trained
on substantial 1D sequences have shown burgeoning capabilities with scale in a
broad range of applications. Nevertheless, no preceding studies consider
combining these different protein modalities to promote the representation
power of geometric neural networks. To address this gap, we make the foremost
step to integrate the knowledge learned by well-trained protein language models
into several state-of-the-art geometric networks. Experiments are evaluated on
a variety of protein representation learning benchmarks, including
protein-protein interface prediction, model quality assessment, protein-protein
rigid-body docking, and binding affinity prediction, leading to an overall
improvement of 20% over baselines and the new state-of-the-art performance.
Strong evidence indicates that the incorporation of protein language models'
knowledge enhances geometric networks' capacity by a significant margin and can
be generalized to complex tasks.
